intro: Cynanchum bolivarense, commonly known as the Bolivian milkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae, which includes milkweeds and other similar species. The plant is characterized by its slender stems, opposite leaves, and showy, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters. It produces a milky sap, which is a common feature among members of its family. Cynanchum bolivarense is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils.
